reviews.comment_content:
FXXK U!
NIGHTMARE to Accounting students

I guess the content is not too bad but everything was screwed up by the professor.

Good luck to later students.
reviews.comment_teaching:
EXTREMELY HORRIBLE. WORST EVER!!!!

You never know what he is talking about. The notes and the teaching are so disorganized.

He is so arrogant and lazy. He has some gay porn tabs on the screen shared to us. Maybe the only thing u can learn is to watch gay porn.

He never listens to students views and many students get mad because of him. He never apologizes for his mistakes.

The TA, KK LEE, is as rubbish as Honic Ip.
They should get married because of their hea attitude.
reviews.comment_grading:
SH!TTY as well.

He changes 70% of his grading method DURING THE SEMESTER. He has many excuses to push his responsibilities to others. He did not do any preparation before the start of the semester!

FXXKING lazy guy who just change the dates and company name from the optional assignments to the real midterm!

We student are so confused about this course. He never makes things clear. I feel mad as FXXK!

reviews.author: tingtingo_O
reviews.title: NIGNTMARE TO ALL ACCT STUDENTS
reviews.comment_content:
Don't know what I've learned throughout the course

Notes are very messy and disorganized. Study materials are wordy and the PPT slides only consist of some keywords, which is extremely difficult to refer to where he is talking.

The prof is more terrible than Terry in 4510 Auditing. I can't imagine why he passed the recruitment. TA is also not responsive to reply to your inquiries.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The notes are very disorganized, just like it is copied and paste from somewhere else.

The prof. basically don't explain the concepts and said I expect you to read it by yourself. Remember this is a LAW course and we are ACCOUNTING students. How can you expect we understand all those concepts just by self-study? If we can self-study all stuff, why UST need to hire an instructor for the course instead of just asking students to read all the contents?

After around week 3 or 4, only around 15 people attend his lectures only as the lectures really can't help you much.

Prof never listens to students' views and use a defensive attitude towards these concerns, like he is always the correct one. Always has different excuses to push responsibility to others.

More importantly, he sometimes forgets the ending time of the class and ends the meeting 20 minutes earlier. He will also suddenly say oh I think it is xx: xx and I will stop the lecture now, which I think this is so awkward. The content of this course is already so voluminous, can't you talk a bit more or stay for a while to cover more content?
reviews.comment_grading:
Messy arrangement for the assessment method. Multiple changes were made throughout the semester.

The beginning version of assessment method:
Take-home Midterm 1 (35%) (2 weeks)
Take-home Midterm 2 (35%) (2 weeks)
Final Exam (30%)

The final version of assessment method after the changes
Group Project (35%)
Take-home Midterm (35%) (24 HOURS ONLY)
Final Exam (30%)

Seems some students are very unsatisfied with the numerous changes throughout the semester and filed complain to the department.

Don't look forward to the final grade as I really have no idea what I've learned in the course

22/6 Update:
The final grade was finally released today though the final is taken on 25/5, which consists of MC questions only. Not sure the slow grade release is due to our "great" professor or TA's "hard work".

Received an A finally with no scores of any components being announced in Canvas. Zero transparency of grading in this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Extremely heavy.

The group project has no guidance or instruction at all. Previous company law under David's time only needs to do 4 questions in a group, but this year we need to write a report, PPT slide, and presentation video?!

No solutions or feedback for the optional assignments (maybe because he just changed the name or the company of the optional assignment to become our midterm paper??)

Basically need to self study all the notes by yourself as few explanations were made during the lecture.

reviews.author: Avocado.Bread
reviews.title: WORST PROFESSOR EVER
reviews.comment_content: The prof gave optional assignment for us to learn and prepare for the exam. However, he would not provide any feedback/ answers for us.
reviews.comment_teaching:
This is the worst professor in HKUST.

In the beginning of the semester, he mentioned he will not go over all the study material and expect students self-study. This is because ACCT4610 is an advanced law courses and expect students have knowledge and ability to learn the laws by themselves. (SERIOUSLY????? So what is the purpose of this course??????)

Also, the notes are very disorganized. He just copied and pasted from somewhere and some of his notes are duplicated LOL. Very wordy, similar to a book.
reviews.comment_grading:
Group Project + Peer Evaluation (25%+10%)
Take-home Midterm (35%)
Final Exam (30%)

The prof. changed the grading for many times. Many people complained about this but he still think he is doing good LOL.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is SUPER HIGH.

1. Group Project (25%):
- Literature Review
- Research Essay (min. 3000 words)
- Group presentation video
Students have to set the topic by themselves with NO GUIDELINE. After submitting the project outline, NO feedback or score obtained.

2. Peer Evaluation of Group Project (10%)

3. Take-home Midterm (24 hours)
- 4 essays questions
***The questions consist of 7 pages LOL***

4. Assignment (Optional)
Don't do it, no answers will be given and you cannot know whether you are doing it correctly. Just spend your time in other courses.

5. Final Exam (Cumulative)

reviews.author: kh1203
reviews.title: Such a 'gift' for final year accounting major students
reviews.comment_content: Normal and boring as expected, so I am fine with the course content.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nightmare.... No focus at all.... full of fillers.... his English proficiency makes me hard to believe that he is teaching a law course. Very stubborn, argue a lot, refuse to face his problem(disorganized assignment arrangement, lack of feedback and guideline) despite receiving many concerns and emails from students, and always have lots of excuses. I thought I would never face a lecturer worse than Terry, until I met him... If it is not my final spring semester, I would definitely drop this course and wait until there is a new professor replacing him...
Speechless about his messy notes and irresponsible performance.. Frequently end class earlier and miss to send important announcement to students (such as changing of exam methods)
So many assignments and a difficult group project, but no guideline or feedback at all, you have to learn and cooperate with your group mates. Do not expect he will help.
You will be more confused by listening to his lectures, suggest to find online teaching videos of HKU or borrow comp law notes from other U such as CU or City..
reviews.comment_grading:
Zero transparency. Like roller-coaster, none of the assignment result is revealed and therefore you could only know your result when the final grade is released.
B+ at the end, however, this course will always be my nightmare in the whole UST life and I sincerely hope no one would receive such a 'gift' next year...
reviews.comment_workload: Superrrrrrr high, all the worst things (boring content, poor lecturer, zero transparency grading, frequently changed exam method, lots of assignment) combined together. So many readings and case and self-learning materials.....

reviews.author: Kitty Leung
reviews.comment_content:
Typical accounting course.

Topics:
(1) Corporate personality and the nature of the limited liability company
(2) Constitution of a company
(3) Management and administration a company (I): Directors and company secretary
(4) Management and administration a company (II): Shareholders and general meetings
(5) Capital and finance of companies
(6) Takeovers
(7) Company liquidation
(8) External regulatory bodies

For each topic, there are teaching materials, inclass exercises and answer keys. The last topic is self study and there is only 1 question.
reviews.comment_teaching: David is quite funny. As law is boring, he tries to add jokes and tell stories when reading the cases. Also, he will give many examples and stresses on the important points. So do attend class and pay attention!
reviews.comment_grading:
Group assignment (20%) (60/60, mean 56)
Midterm (45%) (53/60, mean: 47.9, sd: 5.34)
Final (35%) (42/50, mean: 37, sd: 6)

A grade!

As the midterm covers almost half of the weighting and the coverage is ralatively small, you should try to revise hard and write faster and more during the time limit!
reviews.comment_workload:
Group assignment is last year midterm paper, which is quite useful for midterm revision. 4 people in group by self-selection. There are two questions you can find on the internet.

Midterm and final are both open book open notes. Yet, the time is limited and there are lots of notes. So it is advised to prepare two to three pages own notes for easier copying! Also read and write faster!

Midterm is long question. It covers topic 1 to topic 4 part 1. The questions are quite predictable as there are only a few main topics. Do spend time reading all the notes and answer keys to familiarize with the content materials. The most important thing is to use David's IRAC framework, or else marks will be deducted.

Final is 50MCQs. It covers everything but mainly on topics after midterm. There are many tricky questions as you know David's style, so look at every words and be careful!

reviews.comment_teaching: Pay attention and jot notes in class! He explains the complicated wordings of statutory laws in a simple way which is very helpful in understanding the content. Some extra points that he mentioned in class will also be tested.
reviews.comment_grading:
60% - Open Book Midterm Exam (5 Long Questions): 92/100
40% - Closed Book Final Exam (40 MCQs): 37/40
Final Grade: A+

Study the common law cases of the materials and remember to use the IRAC structure in answering the long questions. The questions are very similar to the common law cases and in-class questions.
Multiple choice questions are very tricky so please do pay attention to the wordings of the answers available.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. You just need to study the answers to the questions outside the class. No assignment throughout the course.

reviews.comment_teaching:
David's teaching is very good. He taught very smoothly in every class and explain the cases using a simple diagram. Some cases and ordinances use legal terms that we business students could not understand but David will explain them clearly, making sure that we understand everything.
For each topic, there would be teaching materials, practice questions, and answer keys for those questions.
David would first teach the materials, then discuss the practice questions with us by applying what we have just learned in the lecture. You would understand how to apply the rules and analyze the cases.
It is such a blessing to have David teaching this course again after reading the terrible review of last year's professor^^
David makes the content much easier to understand and follow. It is not a hard course if you pay attention to the lectures.

No workload at all apart from the exams, which is super nice!! You don't need to cram everything for the exams.

reviews.comment_teaching: Worst accounting course ever, never  met a professor before that always change his marking and teaching schedule. He mentioned a lot about students need to learn the materials their own.
reviews.comment_grading: His tests were basically slight changes of the assignments. We have 24 hours to finish the final exam. And I was just copying most of the things from the notes to the  paper. There was also a group project, that requires a group writing and a group presentation video.  Without knowing the marks of the assignments and group project, I can't tell exactly how the grading is.
reviews.comment_workload: You basically need to do self study for the whole subject. With tonnes of technical terms, law cases, assignments and group projects, the workload is a bit heavy to me.

reviews.author: hay
reviews.title: The "best" lecturer in the accounting department! Good luck!
reviews.comment_content: About HK company ordinances and some legal principles.
reviews.comment_teaching: Holly........I don't think any words can describe his unique teaching method or style. In my point of view, I can't imagine that we have a professor like him in our department. I just couldn't focus during the class, basically he is just talking about the importance of "learning attitude"or the reason we need to "read precisely" in most of his class, such a waste of time. Didn't teach much on the notes or the legal principles. Maybe I am shit at learnings and thats why I have such a feelings. Feel free to apply this course and see whether it fits you or not.
reviews.comment_grading: Didn't publish any grading information and assignments marks on canvas. Perhaps, you need to ask him about your personal grade individually.
reviews.comment_workload: Expects you to go through the readings before class and most of the reading contain more than 10000 words which is not easy for an accounting students to understand all the legal principles. The notes format and content are very poor, and you have to spend a lot of time to go through the notes by yourself.
